intro: Cyathea hieronymi, commonly known as the Hieronymi’s tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, unbranched trunk and large, feather-like fronds. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its rhizome is thick and fibrous, supporting the growth of the trunk and roots. Cyathea hieronymi plays a significant role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and contributing to soil stability.
